messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:22): i hate how i have to hit _three_ keys to page up and down in a terminal window on mac
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:22): (specifically a mac laptop, though even a desktop still requires two keys)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:24): peh. it depends on the keyboard!
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:25): my mac laptop requires two keys (fn+up)
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:25): but I had to tweak terminal.app keymappings
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:26): yeah i'm tweaking settings too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:26): I think it's just fn+up here too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:26): But there again I've little idea what the defaults are
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:28): ok i can do it with one hand now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:28): shift-up and shift-down
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:32): i don't suppose there's a way to control what double-click selection behaviour is, either?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:32): s/either/too/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:32): on putty i have it set to just select uri characters, which makes it easy to select uris
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:32): doesn't know of any
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:33): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: AFAIK no
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:33): pre-leopard Cmd+DblCLick was "load link", not it's Cmd+Shift+DblClick
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:33): kind of a pain
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): yeah but that selects | characters
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): so it doesn't work well for me either
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:42): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: did you decrypt the overlap in interleave error with no interleave in sight?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:49): interleave problem found
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I tried to interleave rdf:RDF with *

042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:18): othermaciej: "although I'm not sure if the Microsoft request it was responsive to has been made public" ... those earlier discussions never were made public (as far as I can tell), that's the problem
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:19): This is a powerful reason why the private w3c-css-wg list needs to die.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: ah, did it not work?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: it didn't since duplicate names in interleave are prohibited and * is a duplicate of everything
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:24): (this is a really annoying feature of RELAX NG)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:24): ah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:25): i don't think we want to allow RDF _anywhere_, btw
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:25): <select> <rdf...> would probably not work well
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:25): same with various other cases
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:25): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I thought you said earlies that RDF was OK where metadata elements are OK, i.e. in <head>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:25): i'd recommend just allowing rdf at metadata and block/inline (soon to become "prose") entry points
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:26): i may have misunderstood what you meant
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:26): I got rid of the * that was a bug
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:26): I didn't mean * quantifier. I meant the * name class
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:27): currently, I don't allow RDF on the prose level at all
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:27): that works for me too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:27): only in XHTML <head> and SVG <metadata>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:28): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I fixed the "Error: Both operands of interleave contain text" by giving up on the RNG conversion and just using XSD
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:29): (Now I've imported the XSLT schema and so the XSD->RNG converter just gives up and dies before getting that far)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:30): (Incidentally, I'm probably doing stuff stupidly since I really have no idea about any of this, but at least it seems to be working at the moment)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:37): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: FYI, http://golem.ph.utexas.edu/~distler/blog/archives/001475.html#c013846
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:40): yeah, we need to figure something out
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:40): the parsing issue is the biggest problem, frankly
